Class NaiveBayes

  • java.lang.Object
    • NaiveBayes

  • public class NaiveBayes
extends java.lang.Object
    This class uses Naive Byes to classify news documents. It outputs a confusion matrix for its performance on classifying each set of data. The files input into the classifier are a processed version of the 20Newsgroups data set. The 20 Newsgroups data set is a collection of approximately 20,000 newsgroup documents, partitioned (nearly) evenly across 20 different newsgroups. It was originally collected by Ken Lang, probably for his "Newsweeder: Learning to filter netnews" paper, though he did not explicitly mention this collection.
    Author:
    Matthew Burke

    • Field Detail

      • testDataArr

        public double[][] testDataArr

    • Constructor Detail

      • NaiveBayes

        public NaiveBayes(java.io.File vocab,
                  java.io.File map,
                  java.io.File trainLabel,
                  java.io.File trainData,
                  java.io.File testLabel,
                  java.io.File testData)
           throws java.io.IOException
        Constructs a Naive Bayes classifier from the specified files.
        Parameters:
        vocab - A list of all of the words contained in the set of news documents. The word ID is the integer corresponding a word's order in this list.
        map - Indexes each category as an integer
        trainLabel - Each index in this file corresponds to a document ID in trainData, and the value at each index is the category that the document belongs in.
        trainData - A CSV file with each row formatted as Document ID, word ID, number of occurances of the word in the document.
        testLabel - The same as trainLabel, but not used for training the model. Used to evaluate the model.
        testData - The same as trainData, but not used for training the model. Used to evaluate the model.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
